Package io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.impl

Class ServerConfigImpl

java.lang.Object
io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.impl.ServerConfigImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServerConfig
public class ServerConfigImpl extends Object implements ServerConfig
Default implementation of the ServerConfig interface.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ServerConfigImpl()
    Creates a new empty configuration instance.

      public ServerConfig https(boolean enabled)
      Used to control the enabled/disabled state of HTTPS on the server. By default HTTPS is disabled.
      Specified by:
      https in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      enabled - optional toggle value (true if not specified)
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

      Returns:

    • getWorkerThreads

      public int getWorkerThreads()
      Retrieves the number of Worker threads configured. Defaults to 8.
      Returns:
      the number of worker threads

    • autoStart

      public ServerConfig autoStart(boolean autoStart)
      Used to enable/disable the auto-start feature, which will start the server after any call to either of the expectations configuration methods. With this setting enabled, any other calls to the start() method are ignored. Further configuration is allowed.

      Auto-start is enabled by default.

      Specified by:
      autoStart in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      autoStart - whether or not auto-start is enabled
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • timeout

      public ServerConfig timeout(int value, TimeUnit units)
      Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server. If not specified, SECONDS will be used as the units.

      The IDLE_TIMEOUT, NO_REQUEST_TIMEOUT, REQUEST_PARSE_TIMEOUT, READ_TIMEOUT and WRITE_TIMEOUT are all configured to the same specified value.

      Specified by:
      timeout in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      value - the timeout value
      units - the units the timeout is specified with (or SECONDS)
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • reportToConsole

      public ServerConfig reportToConsole(boolean toConsole)
      Used to toggle the console output of mismatched request reports. By default they are only rendered in the logging. A value of true will cause the report to be output on the console as well.
      Specified by:
      reportToConsole in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      toConsole - whether or not the report should also be written to the console
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • keystore

      public ServerConfig keystore(URL location, String password)
      Allows configuration of an external HTTPS keystore with the given location and password. By default, if this is not specified an internally provided keystore will be used for HTTPS certification. See the User Guide for details about configuring your own keystore.
      Specified by:
      keystore in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      location - the URL of the keystore file
      password - the keystore file password (defaults to "ersatz" if omitted)
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • keystore

      public ServerConfig keystore(URL location)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Allows configuration of an external HTTPS keystore with the given location (using the default password "ersatz"). By default, if this is not specified an internally provided keystore will be used for HTTPS certification. See the User Guide for details about configuring your own keystore.
      Specified by:
      keystore in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      location - the URL of the keystore file
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • expectations

      public ServerConfig expectations(Consumer<Expectations> expects)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Used to configure HTTP expectations on the server; the provided Consumer<Expectations> implementation will have an active Expectations object passed into it for configuring server interaction expectations. If auto-start is enabled (default) the server will be started after the expectations are applied.
      Specified by:
      expectations in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      expects - the Consumer<Expectations> instance to perform the configuration
      Returns:
      a reference to this server

    • expects

      public Expectations expects()
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      An alternate means of starting the expectation chain.
      Specified by:
      expects in interface ServerConfig
      Returns:
      the reference to the Expectation configuration object

    • decoder

      public ServerConfig decoder(String contentType, BiFunction<byte[],DecodingContext,Object> decoder)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Configures the given request content decoder for the specified request content-type. The decoder will be configured globally and used if no overriding decoder is provided during expectation configuration.
      Specified by:
      decoder in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      contentType - the request content-type
      decoder - the request content decoder
      Returns:
      the reference to the server configuration

    • encoder

      public ServerConfig encoder(String contentType, Class objectType, Function<Object,byte[]> encoder)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Registers a global response body encoder.

      param contentType the response content-type to be encoded

      Specified by:
      encoder in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      contentType - the response content type to be encoded
      objectType - the response object type to be encoded
      encoder - the encoder function
      Returns:
      a reference to this server configuration

    • httpPort

      public ServerConfig httpPort(int serverPort)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Allows the specific configuration of the HTTP server port. The default ephemeral port should be used in most cases since specifying the port will negate the ability to run tests in parallel and will also allow possible collisions with other running servers on the host.

      Do NOT specify this setting unless you really need to.

      Specified by:
      httpPort in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      serverPort - the desired HTTP port
      Returns:
      a reference to this server configuration

    • httpsPort

      public ServerConfig httpsPort(int serverPort)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Allows the specific configuration of the HTTPS server port. The default ephemeral port should be used in most cases since specifying the port will negate the ability to run tests in parallel and will also allow possible collisions with other running servers on the host.

      Do NOT specify this setting unless you really need to.

      Specified by:
      httpsPort in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      serverPort - the desired HTTPS port
      Returns:
      a reference to this server configuration

    • logResponseContent

      public ServerConfig logResponseContent(boolean value)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Causes the full response content to be rendered in the server log message (if true) for the cases where the response content is a renderable textual response. If false (or binary response) only the number of bytes and content type will be rendered for the response.
      Specified by:
      logResponseContent in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      value - whether or not to enable logging of response content (false by default)
      Returns:
      a reference to this server configuration.

    • serverThreads

      public ServerConfig serverThreads(int io, int worker)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Allows the configuration of the number of IO and Worker threads to be used by the underlying server.
      Specified by:
      serverThreads in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      io - the number of IO threads (should be fewer than workers; default is 2)
      worker - the number of worker threads (should be more than io; default is 16)
      Returns:
      a reference to this server configuration

    • requirements

      public ServerConfig requirements(Consumer<Requirements> requires)
      Description copied from interface: ServerConfig
      Allows the configuration of any global request requirements.
      Specified by:
      requirements in interface ServerConfig
      Parameters:
      requires - the requirements configuration consumer
      Returns:
      a reference to this server configuration
